proof of
impossibility,  and  that  won’t  be  complete  until  Behe  and  his  allies  have
shown that all the conceivable scenarios through which bacteria might ac-
quire flagella are flawed. Really demonstrating impossibility—or even im-
probability—here and in kindred instances, is extremely difficult, precisely
because it would require a much more systematic survey of the molecular
differences among bacteria.
